prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a new sketch on face 1. * Sketch a circle with center at [0.375, 0.375] and radius of 0.375 on face 1. Close the sketch. Create a new extrusion with the following properties: * Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.1875 and opposite normal to 0.0. * Set the sketch scale to 0.75. * Set the operation to "Create a new solid body". The resulting object is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, the height of which is approximately three times its diameter. The diameter of the central hole is about half the diameter of the cylinder. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. The dimensions of the object are: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.1875 **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.2938, 0.2938, 0.1875]. Next, create a new sketch on face 1. * Sketch a circle with center at [0.0812, 0.0812] and radius of 0.0812 on face 1. Close the sketch. Create a new extrusion with the following properties: * Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0 and opposite normal to 0.075. * Set the sketch scale to 0.1625. * Set the operation to "Cut material". The resulting object is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The dimensions of the object are: * Length: 0.1625 * Width: 0.1625 * Height: 0.075</description>

<description>**Intermediate CAD Part 1: Metallic Chain Link** **1. Create Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0203, 0.0203, 0.0] **2. Draw 2D Sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face_1) and multiple loops (loop_1, loop_2, loop_3, loop_4, and loop_5) and circles. **3. Create Loop 1** Create the first loop (loop_1) using the circle_1 with the following properties: * Center: [0.1135, 0.1135] * Radius: 0.1135 **4. Create Loop 2** Create the second loop (loop_2) using three arcs: * Arc 1: Start Point [0.08, 0.2429], Mid Point [0.0009, 0.0413], End Point [0.2172, 0.0291] * Arc 2: Start Point [0.2172, 0.0291], Mid Point [0.3618, 0.1114], End Point [0.5006, 0.0197] * Arc 3: Start Point [0.5006, 0.0197], Mid Point [0.7148, 0.0521], End Point [0.6172, 0.2455] **5. Create Loop 3** Create the third loop (loop_3) using a circle_1 with the following properties: * Center: [0.3547, 0.2528] * Radius: 0.1135 **6. Create Loop 4** Create the fourth loop (loop_4) using a circle_1 with the following properties: * Center: [0.3547, 0.5314] * Radius: 0.1135 **7. Create Loop 5** Create the fifth loop (loop_5) using a circle_1 with the following properties: * Center: [0.596, 0.1135] * Radius: 0.1135 **8. Scale Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7148. **9. Transform Sketch to 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the normal vector and the extrusion depth specified. **10. Extrude Sketch** Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.0709 units. The height, width, and length of the final CAD shape are 0.0709, 0.7148, and 0.7148 units, respectively.</description>

<description>Part 1: Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will be the base for your CAD part. Next, create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain two faces, face\\_1 and face\\_2. On face\\_1, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of four lines. The lines should have the following start and end points: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0441, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.0441, 0.0] to [0.0441, 0.0221] * Line 3: [0.0441, 0.0221] to [0.0, 0.0221] * Line 4: [0.0, 0.0221] to [0.0, 0.0] On face\\_2, create another loop (loop\\_2) consisting of four lines with the following start and end points: * Line 1: [0.0028, 0.0028] to [0.0414, 0.0028] * Line 2: [0.0414, 0.0028] to [0.0414, 0.0193] * Line 3: [0.0414, 0.0193] to [0.0028, 0.0193] * Line 4: [0.0028, 0.0193] to [0.0028, 0.0028] Now, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system properties. Next, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.75 units. This will result in a 3D model of a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.0441, 0.0441, and 0.75 units respectively. The boolean operation for this part is to create a new solid body.</description>

<description>**Construction Instructions for the Final Shape** The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units by 2 units by 1 unit. The following sections outline the steps to construct each of the intermediate parts required to build the final shape. <part_1> Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units by 4 units by 5 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3, 0.0] 2. **Create a 2D sketch on face_1** of the coordinate system defined in step 1. 3. **Create the following lines** on the sketch (enumerated in sequence): - First line: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Second line: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.45] - Third line: Start Point [0.75, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.45] - Fourth line: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the sketch** with a factor of 0.75. 5. **Extrude the scaled sketch** by 0.3 units along the normal axis to create the first part. <part_2> Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The top is wider than the bottom. The object has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a reflective material. The dimensions of the cylinder are approximately 0.15 units in height, 0.15 units in width, and 0.15 units in length. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.3, 0.0, 0.15] 2. **Create a 2D sketch on face_1** of the coordinate system defined in step 1. 3. **Create a circle** on the sketch with a center at [0.075, 0.075] and a radius of 0.075 units. 4. **Scale the sketch** with a factor of 0.15. 5. **Extrude the scaled sketch** opposite to the normal direction by 0.225 units to create the second part. This will remove material from the prism, creating a cylindrical hole. <part_3> Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter. The top and bottom of the cylinder are flat. The dimensions of the cylinder are approximately 0.15 units in height, 0.15 units in width, and 0.45 units in length. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.225, 0.15] 2. **Create a 2D sketch on face_1** of the coordinate system defined in step 1. 3. **Create a circle** on the sketch with a center at [0.075, 0.075] and a radius of 0.075 units. 4. **Scale the sketch** with a factor of 0.15. 5. **Extrude the scaled sketch** opposite to the normal direction by 0.45 units to create the third part. This will further remove material from the prism, finalizing the cylindrical hole.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** The first part of the CAD assembly is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 4 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 0.5 units. To create this part, follow these steps: 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Create a 2D sketch** on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Draw the sketch geometry** as follows: - Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. - Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.1875]. - Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.1875] to point [0.4063, 0.1875]. - Draw a line from point [0.4063, 0.1875] to point [0.375, 0.25]. - Draw a line from point [0.375, 0.25] to point [0.25, 0.25]. - Draw a line from point [0.25, 0.25] to point [0.25, 0.1875]. - Draw a line from point [0.25, 0.1875] to point [0.3125, 0.1875]. - Draw a line from point [0.3125, 0.1875] to point [0.3125, 0.125]. - Draw a line from point [0.3125, 0.125] to point [0.0625, 0.125]. - Draw a line from point [0.0625, 0.125] to point [0.0625, 0.1875]. - Draw a line from point [0.0625, 0.1875] to point [0.125, 0.1875]. - Draw a line from point [0.125, 0.1875] to point [0.125, 0.25]. - Draw a line from point [0.125, 0.25] to point [0.0, 0.25]. - Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.25] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This sketch forms the profile of the rectangular prism with the cylindrical hole. 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** using the coordinate system properties. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch** along the Z-axis of the coordinate system with an extrusion depth of 0.375 units. **Part Completion** With these steps, you will have completed the first part of the CAD assembly, which is the 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 4 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 0.5 units.</description>
